page.title: 03THE RIVER PONT
page.content: The{River Pont}flows through Ponteland for around four miles with the whole stretch of the Pont being around seven miles long. The river is partly under private ownership, for instance the stretch which runs behind Runneymede Road.The rest of the river is controlled by the{Northumbrian Water {Authority}(N.W.A.). Although the river Pont is a very small river compared to waters such as the rivers{Tyne}or {Wansbeck,}it still contains quite a large variety of fish.These include brown trout,grayling,eels,perch and gudgeon to a smaller extent. Also a few rainbow trout have just been introduced. The recent building of the sewage works at{Fox Covert Lane has killed a large number of fish but on the whole the Pont is mainly a good trout stream.
